Comment: When I worked for AT&T years ago, I had at least two angry boomers call in about this fee on their bills that was either the digital equity act or something similar. It was like 5¬¢ each month and goes towards providing access to phone lines anywhere in the USA for the same installation price. So rural Arkansas and Metro Detroit had the same installation and service fees regardless of how expensive it was for the company to the install the phone lines.   These boomers had heard that the government was giving away "free phones to illegals" and wanted to make sure their 5¬¢ wasn't going towards "illegal aliens".   It was one of the first times I had encountered the seething hatred Americans have for immigrants.
